Cikini Kini: Hilang Rindang Angsana, Menanti Tabebuya
04 Nov 2019, 22:08 by Tim detikcom
Jakarta - Wajah kawasan Cikini perlahan berubah. Setelah trotoar, kabel, kini pohon-pohon yang akan berganti. Tak ada lagi pohon angsana melainkan tabebuya yang akan menggantikan.
Pohon-pohon angsana yang rindang kini sudah tidak terlihat lagi di trotoar Jalan Cikini Raya, Jakarta Pusat. Pohon-pohon yang ditebang itu ada di tengah-tengah trotoar yang sebelumnya diperlebar.
Kondisi pohon saat ini memang sudah habis ditebang, hanya tersisa bagian akar dengan tinggi sekitar 5 cm di atas permukaan tanah. Tampak sejumlah petugas Dinas Kehutanan sedang menggali pohon Angsana itu satu persatu agar bersih.
"Iya ini kita ditugaskan saja untuk bantu nyabutin sisa-sisa pohonnya. Ini kan susah ya, udah mengakar banget, jadi kita dibantu juga sama petugas dinas kehutanan dari utara," kata salah satu petugas dinas kehutanan Jakarta Pusat di lokasi.

Alasan Penebangan Pohon

Pemkot Jakarta Pusat beralasan pohon-pohon itu ditebang demi keamanan saat masuk musim hujan. Pohon besar dikhawatirkan bisa roboh.
"Itu rindang, terlalu ini. Takutnya nibanin jalan kan mau musim hujan," ucap Wakil Wali Kota Jakarta Pusat Irwandi, saat dihubungi, Senin (4/11/2019).
"Itu kan, kita (masuk) musim hujan. Pohon sudah tua, yang ke jalanan di-toping (pangkas bagian atas), ada dipotong, kan masuk musim penghujan," sambungnya.


Foto: Pohon besar di Cikini ditebang (Eva Safitri/detikcom)

Cikini Now: Missing Angsana Shade, Waiting for Tabebuya
Nov 04 2019, 22:08 by Tim detikcom
Jakarta - The face of the Cikini area is slowly changing. After the sidewalk, the cable, now the trees will change. No more angsana trees but Tabebuya will replace them.
The shady angsana trees are no longer visible on the sidewalk of Jalan Cikini Raya, Central Jakarta. The trees that were cut down are in the middle of the sidewalk that was previously widened.
The current condition of the tree has already been cut down, leaving only the roots with a height of about 5 cm above the surface of the soil. It appears that a number of Forestry Service officials were digging Angsana trees one by one so that they were clean.
"Yes, we are just assigned to help routine the remnants of the trees. This is difficult, it's already very deep-rooted, so we are also assisted by forestry service officers from the north," said one of the Central Jakarta forestry service officers at the location.

Reasons for Tree felling

Central Jakarta City Government said the trees were cut down for safety during the rainy season. It is feared that a large tree could collapse.
"It is shady, too this. Fear of nibanin the road would like the rainy season," said Deputy Mayor of Central Jakarta Irwandi, when contacted on Monday (11/04/2019).
"That's right, we (entered) the rainy season. Trees are old, the ones to the streets are topped (cut the top), there are cut, right into the rainy season," he continued.
